subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
{{zh-ref|Wang (1982)}} relates this word to {{och-l|羖|(black) [[ram]]}}, {{och-l|牯|male bovine}} and {{och-l|麚|stag}}; thus, this word is likely a general word for “male animal”. However, {{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}} considers {{och-l|牯}} to be a post-classical loanword from {{cog|aav}}, and {{och-l|羖}} a cognate to {{och-l|羯|[[wether]]}}. See these entries for more.

The common word for “pig” in most modern varieties of Chinese, {{och-l|豬}}, is likely a derivative. See there for more.
